H0.text: A hawk eating a mouse is the best example of the decomposition process where organic material is recycled in an ecosystem.

H1.text: Worms tunneling through soil is the best example of the decomposition process that recycles organic material in an ecosystem, thereby recycling nutrients.

H2.text: Bacteria feeding on dead plants is the best example of the decomposition process where organic material is recycled in an ecosystem.

H3.text: A plant using nitrogen to make proteins is the best example of the decomposition process that recycles organic material in an ecosystem, where nutrients are returned to the system as materials decompose.

A4.text: Bacteria are responsible for the putrefaction stage in this process.

A5.text: Bacteria play a vital role in many stages of the nutrient cycle by recycling nutrients and the fixation of nitrogen from the atmosphere.
